alert.note: Alert for Benton (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 8:00AM CDT until further notice by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Benton and Washington AR. In Oklahoma, Adair, Cherokee, Delaware, Mayes, Muskogee and Wagoner. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rogers... Bentonville... Tahlequah... Siloam Springs... Wagoner... Bella Vista... Lowell... Pea Ridge... Fort Gibson... Gentry... Tontitown... Gravette... Cave Springs... Decatur... Westville... West Siloam Springs... Colcord... Kansas... Okay... Hulbert... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
